definition: to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He would also wear sunglasses to hide his blue eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他還帶了墨鏡來遮住自己的藍眼睛。

sentences.english: A lock of hair had fallen down over her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一綹劉海遮住她的雙眼。

sentences.english: Covering the artist's name, reveal the card to target player.
sentences.chinese: 把繪製畫家的名字遮住，並向目標玩家展示該牌。

sentences.english: The sky so blue, so blue it covered like clouds like cotton candy.
sentences.chinese: 天空好藍，藍得遮住了那像棉花糖似的雲朵。

sentences.english: That wall blocks out all the light.
But passion is an emotion that blinds you.
sentences.chinese: 但是，激情卻會遮住你的慧眼，誤導你的判斷。

sentences.english: That hat's too big. It keeps slipping down over the boy's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那頂帽子太大，老是滑下來遮住那男孩子的眼睛。

sentences.english: As the moon eclipses the sun the sky grows darker.
sentences.chinese: 當月球遮住太陽時，天空漸漸變得昏暗了。

sentences.english: With her cloud-pale eyelids falling on dream-dimmed eyes;
sentences.chinese: 蒼雲般的眼瞼遮住夢幻般的眼睛。

sentences.english: Cover your mouth with a  handkerchief or clothing.
The Twisted Headbands favor people who want hair out of their face and it also works on curly hair.
sentences.chinese: 麻花頭帶適合希望頭髮不要遮住臉的人，也適合捲髮。

sentences.english: The doctor pulled his hood forward, hiding his face .
sentences.chinese: 大夫把袍子上的帽子向前拉了一拉，遮住他的臉。

sentences.english: The creases in her skin hid the shape and color of her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她皮膚上的褶子遮住了她眼睛的形狀和顏色。

sentences.english: She wore her hat at a tilt over her left eye.
sentences.chinese: 她歪戴着帽子遮住左眼。

sentences.english: The door was partially concealed by the drapes.
sentences.chinese: 門有一部分被門簾遮住了。

sentences.english: We put a tarpaulin across the window to block out the sun - light.
sentences.chinese: 我們將油布橫掛在窗子上遮住陽光。

definition: to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
half of sth/one side of sth
